definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

sentences.english: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
sentences.chinese: 不知不觉，我的心将我安置在我尊长的车中。

sentences.english: When an elder is standing, do not sit .
sentences.chinese: 当尊长还站着，你不要坐下。

sentences.english: Reverend sir, forgive this pair of sinners.
sentences.chinese: 恭敬的尊长，宽恕这一对犯人吧。

sentences.english: In front of an elder, do not show off.
sentences.chinese: 在尊长的面前，不要卖弄自己的才能。

sentences.english: But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him
sentences.chinese: 祭司长，和文士，与百姓的尊长，都想要杀他。

sentences.english: In front of an elder, I will never show off.
sentences.chinese: 在尊长前，不要卖弄自己的才能。

sentences.english: When meeting an elder, walk briskly towards him.
sentences.chinese: 遇到尊长，要快速的走到他的面前。

definition: the younger generation/those who come after
relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
offspring/future generations/younger generation of a family/junior members of a group
to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
